name: Bamberg
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bamberg's Rauchbier (smoked beer) dates back to medieval times when all beer was accidentally smoked from drying malt over beechwood fires - while other breweries modernized, Bamberg kept the tradition alive, and now tourists make pilgrimages just to taste this smoky, bacon-flavored beer that most people either love or hate.

hero_dishes.name: SchÃ¤uferla
hero_dishes.description: Roasted pork shoulder cooked in beer-infused broth - the meat is fall-apart tender with impossibly crispy crackling skin
hero_dishes.origin_story: This is Franconian soul food at its finest. The pork shoulder is slow-roasted for hours, often in Rauchbier, creating meat so tender it barely needs a knife. The crackling is the prize
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Schlenkerla, Brauerei Spezial (paired with smoked beer)

hero_dishes.name: Blaue Zipfel
hero_dishes.description: Blue sausages simmered in tangy vinegar and wine broth, served with sauerkraut and fresh pretzels
hero_dishes.origin_story: The name comes from the sausages' bluish color after simmering in the spiced vinegar broth. This is a uniquely Franconian dish that showcases the region's love of bold, tangy flavors
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Schlenkerla (DominikanerstraÃŸe 6 - served with sauerkraut and potatoes)

hero_dishes.name: Bamberg Zwiebel
hero_dishes.description: Ground pork and bacon mixture filled into a hollowed onion and slow-roasted, finished with Bamberg smoked beer
hero_dishes.origin_story: This labor-intensive dish is almost like meatloaf stuffed inside an onion. The addition of Rauchbier towards the end adds smoky depth and is pure Bamberg
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Schlenkerla (most popular place to order it)

hero_dishes.origin_story: The Bamberger HÃ¶rnla potato is so prized that top chefs seek it out. The pastry of the same name is equally beloved, showing Bamberg's dual culinary personality
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Local markets for potatoes, bakeries for pastries, top restaurants for both

signature_drinks.name: Rauchbier (Smoked Beer)
signature_drinks.description: Beer made with malt dried over beechwood fires - intensely smoky, like drinking liquid bacon
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At Schlenkerla and Brauerei Spezial, the two most famous smoked beer breweries. It's an acquired taste - most people are shocked by the first sip but by the third they're converted

signature_drinks.name: Smoked Beer Truffle Hot Chocolate
signature_drinks.description: Smooth chocolate infused with Rauchbier - curious, elegant pairing of smoke and sweetness

food_culture_notes: Schlenkerla is a well-established family-owned brewery known for unique smoked beer and traditional Bavarian cuisine
Brauerei Spezial follows traditional methods by malting its own grain over beechwood fire instead of buying from malting facilities
